results.title: Soul music: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte one
results.brief_description: Great A’Tuin is a giant turtle, floating through space, and on his back stand four elephants, on their backs, there rests the Discworld. This is the setting for Terry Pratchett’s adventure, the ‘Discworld’. There is a new and addictive music on the disc! When Imp Y Celyn, a young harpist (who looks a bit elvish) arrives in Anhk Morpock, the town will never be the same again. He forms ‘The Band With Rocks In’ with his friends Lias and Glod and changes his name to Buddy. Meanwhile Susan St Helit has a problem, her Grandfather is Death, and he’s missing.

results.title: Soul collection - back to Stax
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dorfman, Ben Sidran, Clive Woods and Midem Music
results.brief_description: This concert, held in 1990, and filmed at the Palais De Festivale Hall in Cannes, France, is a celebration of the achievements of the legendary record company Stax Records. With a distribution deal from Atlantic Records, Stax produced artists that championed the sounds of soul music around the world. This live memorial concert includes performances from: Booker T and the MGs, Phil Upchurch, Carla Thomas, Eddie Floyd, Memphis Horns and Sam Moore.

results.title: SOS Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Paul de Roubaix and Les Films du Centaure
results.brief_description: Shows the work being done by the Charles Darwin Foundation to preserve the Galapagos fauna. Shows te turtles, iguanas and some birds and discusses briefly their importance in Darwin’s research leading to his explanation of evolution. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: SOS
results.brief_description: Comical but scathing indictment of man’s age-old exploitation of women, presented via the historical theories of a mad professor who is convinced that women are temporary visitors from a far-away galaxy. Starring Maurizio Nichetti as the teacher. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sorry book: Kutcha; Larry (A) [Reconciliation advertisements]
results.brief_description: These two short community advertisements (30 seconds each) were made to create awareness about the suffering of indigenous peoples as a result of forced removal from their families in the middle of twentieth century Australia. The audience is asked to consider the current impact experienced by these people today as a direct result of government policy whilst the Aboriginal people are still asking “why?”. Sign the “Sorry book” at www.apology.west.net.au.

results.title: Sorry
results.brief_description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.
results.description: 75 years later, the survivors and their descendants of the Coniston massacre invited my family to remember the past. I went to say sorry. I was the only member of my family to attend.

results.title: Sorok pervyy = The Forty first
results.brief_description:
Set during the civil war in Turkestan, ‘The Forty First’ is a remake of the story of romance with a Red woman commander and her captive White officer. In a remote region of Russia, skirmishes are fought between two armies in conflict. The conditions are trying - in the sand dunes of eastern Russia there are few resources for the embattled soldiers. A courageous sharpshooter, the commander is escorting her prisoner to his new confines when the two are marooned. Inevitably romance erupts between the enemies who are drawn into a struggle involving personal feelings and class identification. Remembering her duty, the commander makes a tragic decision, killing her lover in order to save him from capture, when the pair are rescued by Czarists. A typically patriotic Soviet drama from the 1950s that delves into an interesting wartime moral dilemma.

Credits: Director, Grigorii Chukhrai ; writer, Grigorii Koltunov ; photography, Sergei Urusevskii ; music, Nikolai Kriukov.
Cast: Izolda Izvitskaya, Oleg Strizhenov, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Nikolai Dupak, Georgiy Shapovalov.

results.title: Sophocles: Oedipus the King
results.brief_description: An Abridged version of Sophocles’ play performed in the 5th century BC amphitheatre at Amphiaralon by the Athens Classical Theatre Company styled on the ancient models. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, it features James Mason as Oedipus, Claire Bloom as Jocasta and Ian Richardson as Tiresias.

results.title: Sophie's choice
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Keith Barish and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by William Styron, this is a remarkably faithful adaptation of the original best-seller. Meryl Streep gives a glorious performance as Sophie Zawistowska, the tragic Polish Catholic beauty, who having survived Auschwitz, has settled in America after World War II. The time is 1947. Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a 22 year-old aspiring writer from rural Virginia, rents a room in a Brooklyn boarding house. He is drawn to his exotic upstairs neighbours, Sophie and Nathan (Kevin Kline), a madly romantic couple whose instability and flamboyance utterly capture this young man’s imagination. The deeper he delves into these people’s lives, the more he learns that each harbours terrible and terrifying secrets. This personalised view of the Holocaust and its devastating effect on one woman who survived it, is a shattering, moving experience.
